data.title: Sortiraparis.com
data.text:
Paris: Gare de l'Est closed on Saturday September 21st

Watch out if you're planning to take the train at Gare de l'Est on the weekend of September 21, 2024! The Paris station will be closed for one day, to test the deployment of SNCF's future traffic management system.

Journées du Patrimoine 2024 in Paris: discover the miniature networks under the Gare de l'Est railway station

The Journées du Patrimoine return on Saturday, September 21 and Sunday, September 22, 2024, with a host of not-to-be-missed highlights in Paris and the Île-de-France region. If you're looking for the unusual, head for the Gare de l'Est, where special guided tours await you.

Gare de l'Est in Paris: how to get to other stations and airports from this station?

Located in the 10th arrondissement, Gare de l'Est is one of Paris's major train stations. To make your journey easier and get from one station to another without stress, discover the different routes available to link the Gare de l'Est to the capital's other stations and airports.

Did you know? Model trains lurk beneath the Gare de l'Est!

There's no shortage of hidden places in Paris. Under the Gare de l'Est train station, you can walk along tracks 4 and 5 on a world of miniature trains, run by the Association Française des Amis des Chemins de Fer.

Alsatian Christmas Market at Gare de l'Est in Paris 2023

The famous Alsatian Christmas Market returns to the Gare de l'Est forecourt in Paris from Friday December 1 to Sunday December 17, 2023, with a host of gourmet discoveries on the program!

Ora's vegetarian brunch at La Caserne: a culinary, arty and surprising journey!

Ora, the new-style vegetarian restaurant tucked away in La Caserne, offers a 100% green Sunday brunch in a friendly, laid-back atmosphere. An ethico-artistic canteen where food, in all its forms, composes colorful and gourmet culinary works, right on the tables.

The Place To: restaurant, bar and coworking space in Paris' 10th arrondissement

The Place To is the new coffee shop in Paris's 10th arrondissement! The little brother of the brand's first address on avenue de Wagram, the restaurant welcomes you from early morning until nightfall, with a complete gourmet offer from breakfast to dinner, including lunch and Happy Hour. Bonus: several spaces, several atmospheres, ideal for coworking!

History: these WWII bunkers hidden under Paris

Are you ready to discover what is hiding beneath your feet? Before the Second World War, many bunkers were built in the depths of Paris, and can still be visited today for special occasions.
